Components

Learn how to build your website with boba!

Accordions

Accordions are useful for toggling information beneath headers.

Default Accordion

Each accordion can open and close independently.

Tip

Be sure that the input's type is checkbox and that each of the input's ids match their label's for!

  • Submenu Item 1
  • Submenu Item 2
  • Submenu Item 3
You can place anything inside of an accordion!

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In a ultricies mauris. Donec posuere ultrices tortor. Aliquam fringilla tellus odio, nec vehicula mi placerat nec. Duis bibendum eget ipsum eget dapibus. Aenean sit amet dui at dolor condimentum sagittis.

<div class="accordion-menu">
    <input type="checkbox" id="first-accordion" name="accordion-checkbox" hidden checked />
    <label class="accordion-header" for="first-accordion">
        First Accordion
    </label>
    <div class="accordion-body">
        <ul class="accordion-submenu">
            <li>Submenu Item 1</li>
            <li>Submenu Item 2</li>
            <li>Submenu Item 3</li>
        </ul>
    </div>
</div>

<div class="accordion-menu">
    <input type="checkbox" id="second-accordion" name="accordion-checkbox" hidden checked />
    <label class="accordion-header" for="second-accordion">
        Second Accordion
    </label>
    <div class="accordion-body">
        <h5>You can place anything inside of an accordion!</h5>
        <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In a ultricies mauris. Donec posuere ultrices tortor. Aliquam fringilla tellus odio, nec vehicula mi placerat nec. Duis bibendum eget ipsum eget dapibus. Aenean sit amet dui at dolor condimentum sagittis.</p>
    </div>
</div>

<div class="accordion-menu">
    <input type="checkbox" id="third-accordion" name="accordion-checkbox" hidden checked />
    <label class="accordion-header" for="third-accordion">
        Third Accordion
    </label>
    <div class="accordion-body">
        <img class="img-responsive" src="https://placeholdit.imgix.net/~text?txtsize=33&txt=200%C3%97100&w=200&h=100" alt="Image">
    </div>
</div>

Mutually-Exclusive Accordion

Only one accordion in a group can be open at a time.

Tip

Note that once any of the accordions in the group are opened, one accordion will remain open at all times.


Be sure that the input's type is radio, that each of the input's ids match their label's for, and that each of the inputs have the same name!

  • Submenu Item 1
  • Submenu Item 2
  • Submenu Item 3
You can place anything inside of an accordion!

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In a ultricies mauris. Donec posuere ultrices tortor. Aliquam fringilla tellus odio, nec vehicula mi placerat nec. Duis bibendum eget ipsum eget dapibus. Aenean sit amet dui at dolor condimentum sagittis.

<div class="accordion-menu">
    <input type="radio" id="first-me-accordion" name="accordion-radio" hidden checked />
    <label class="accordion-header" for="first-me-accordion">
        First Accordion
    </label>
    <div class="accordion-body">
        <ul class="accordion-submenu">
            <li>Submenu Item 1</li>
            <li>Submenu Item 2</li>
            <li>Submenu Item 3</li>
        </ul>
    </div>
</div>

<div class="accordion-menu">
    <input type="radio" id="second-me-accordion" name="accordion-radio" hidden />
    <label class="accordion-header" for="second-me-accordion">
        Second Accordion
    </label>
    <div class="accordion-body">
        <h5>You can place anything inside of an accordion!</h5>
        <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In a ultricies mauris. Donec posuere ultrices tortor. Aliquam fringilla tellus odio, nec vehicula mi placerat nec. Duis bibendum eget ipsum eget dapibus. Aenean sit amet dui at dolor condimentum sagittis.</p>
    </div>
</div>

<div class="accordion-menu">
    <input type="radio" id="third-me-accordion" name="accordion-radio" hidden />
    <label class="accordion-header" for="third-me-accordion">
        Third Accordion
    </label>
    <div class="accordion-body">
        <img class="img-responsive" src="https://placeholdit.imgix.net/~text?txtsize=33&txt=200%C3%97100&w=200&h=100" alt="Image">
    </div>
</div>
